2880     * @param encodedColor what to gradually change the cell's color to, as a packed float
2881     * @param duration how long the total transition should take in seconds
2882     */
2883    public void recolor(final int x, final int y, final int layer, final float encodedColor, float duration) {
2884        recolor(0f, x, y, layer, encodedColor, duration, null);

2888    /**
2889     * Changes the foreground in the given layer at position x,y so it becomes the given encodedColor, waiting for
2890     * {@code delay} (in seconds) before performing it, taking duration seconds. The foreground color will keep the 
2891     * changed color after the effect, unless drawn over.
2892     * <br>
2893     * This will only behave correctly if you call {@link Stage#act()} before you call {@link Stage#draw()}, but after
2894     * any changes to the contents of this SparseLayers. If you change the contents, then draw, and then act, that will
2895     * draw the contents without the recolor this applies, then apply the recolor when you call act(), then quickly
2896     * overwrite the recolor in the next frame. That visually appears as nothing happening other than a delay.
2897     * @param delay how long to wait in seconds before starting the effect
2898     * @param x the x-coordinate of the cell to recolor
2899     * @param y the y-coordinate of the cell to recolor
2900     * @param layer which layer to affect; if you haven't specified a layer when placing text, then this should be 0
2901     * @param encodedColor what to gradually change the cell's color to, as a packed float
2902     * @param duration how long the total transition should take in seconds
2903     */
2904    public void recolor(final float delay, final int x, final int y, final int layer, final float encodedColor, float duration) {
2905        recolor(delay, x, y, layer, encodedColor, duration, null);
2906    }
2907
2908
2909    /**
2910     * Changes the foreground in the given layer at position x,y so it becomes the given encodedColor, waiting for
2911     * {@code delay} (in seconds) before performing it, taking duration seconds. The foreground color will keep the 
2912     * changed color after the effect, unless drawn over. Additionally, enqueue {@code postRunnable} for running after
2913     * the created action ends.
2914     * <br>
2915     * This will only behave correctly if you call {@link Stage#act()} before you call {@link Stage#draw()}, but after
2916     * any changes to the contents of this SparseLayers. If you change the contents, then draw, and then act, that will
2917     * draw the contents without the recolor this applies, then apply the recolor when you call act(), then quickly
2918     * overwrite the recolor in the next frame. That visually appears as nothing happening other than a delay.
2919     * @param delay how long to wait in seconds before starting the effect
2920     * @param x the x-coordinate of the cell to recolor
2921     * @param y the y-coordinate of the cell to recolor
2922     * @param layer which layer to affect; if you haven't specified a layer when placing text, then this should be 0
2923     * @param encodedColor what to gradually change the cell's color to, as a packed float
2924     * @param duration how long the total transition should take in seconds
2925     * @param postRunnable a Runnable to execute after the recolor completes; may be null to do nothing.
2926     */
2927    public void recolor(final float delay, final int x, final int y, final int layer, final float encodedColor, float duration,
2928            /* @Nullable */ Runnable postRunnable) {
2929        if(x < 0 || x >= gridWidth || y < 0 || y >= gridHeight || layer < 0 || layer >= layers.size())
2930            return;
2931        final SparseTextMap l = layers.get(layer);
2932        duration = Math.max(0.015f, duration);
2933        final int pos = SparseTextMap.encodePosition(x, y);
2934        final float ac = l.getFloat(pos, 0f);
2935        final int nbActions = 2 + (0 < delay ? 1 : 0) + (postRunnable == null ? 0 : 1);
2936        final Action[] sequence = new Action[nbActions];
2937        int index = 0;
2938        if (0 < delay)
2939            sequence[index++] = Actions.delay(delay);
2940        sequence[index++] = new TemporalAction(duration) {
2941            @Override
2942            protected void update(float percent) {
2943                l.updateFloat(pos, SColor.lerpFloatColors(ac, encodedColor, percent));
2944            }
2945        };
2946        if(postRunnable != null)
2947        {
2948            sequence[index++] = Actions.run(postRunnable);
2949        }
2950        /* Do this one last, so that hasActiveAnimations() returns true during 'postRunnables' */
2951        sequence[index] = Actions.delay(duration, Actions.run(new Runnable() {
2952            @Override
2953            public void run() {
2954                l.updateFloat(pos, encodedColor);
2955            }
2956        }));
2957        addAction(Actions.sequence(sequence));
2958    }
2959
2960    /**
2961     * Draws the SparseLayers and all glyphs it tracks. {@link Batch#begin()} must have already been called on the
2962     * batch, and {@link Batch#end()} should be called after this returns and before the rendering code finishes for the
2963     * frame.
2964     * <br>
2965     * This will set the shader of {@code batch} if using a distance field or MSDF font and the shader is currently not
2966     * configured for such a font; it does not reset the shader to the default so that multiple Actors can all use the
2967     * same shader and so specific extra glyphs or other items can be rendered after calling draw(). If you need to draw
2968     * both a distance field font and full-color art, you should set the shader on the Batch to null when you want to
2969     * draw full-color art, and end the Batch between drawing this object and the other art.
2970     *
2971     * @param batch a Batch such as a {@link FilterBatch} that must be between a begin() and end() call; usually done by Stage
2972     * @param parentAlpha currently ignored
2973     */
2974    @Override
2975    public void draw(Batch batch, float parentAlpha) {
2976        super.draw(batch, parentAlpha);
2977        float xo = getX(), yo = getY(), yOff = yo + 1f + gridHeight * font.actualCellHeight, gxo, gyo;
2978        font.draw(batch, backgrounds, xo, yo);
2979        int len = layers.size();
2980        Frustum frustum = null;
2981        Stage stage = getStage();
2982        if(stage != null) {
2983            Viewport viewport = stage.getViewport();             
2984            if(viewport != null)
2985            {
2986                Camera camera = viewport.getCamera();
2987                if(camera != null)
2988                {
2989                    if(
2990                            camera.frustum != null &&
2991                                    (!camera.frustum.boundsInFrustum(xo, yOff - font.actualCellHeight - 1f, 0f, font.actualCellWidth, font.actualCellHeight, 0f) ||
2992                                     !camera.frustum.boundsInFrustum(xo + font.actualCellWidth * (gridWidth-1), yo, 0f, font.actualCellWidth, font.actualCellHeight, 0f))
2993                    )
2994                        frustum = camera.frustum;
2995                }
2996            }
2997        }
2998        font.configureShader(batch);
2999        if(frustum == null) {
3000            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3001                layers.get(i).draw(batch, font, xo, yOff);
3002            }
3003
3004        }
3005        else
3006        {
3007            for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
3008                layers.get(i).draw(batch, font, frustum, xo, yOff);
3009            }
3010        }
3011        
3012        int x, y;
3013        for (int i = 0; i < glyphs.size(); i++) {
3014            TextCellFactory.Glyph glyph = glyphs.get(i);
3015            if(glyph == null)
3016                continue;
3017            glyph.act(Gdx.graphics.getDeltaTime());
3018            if(
3019                    !glyph.isVisible() ||
3020                    (x = Math.round((gxo = glyph.getX() - xo) / font.actualCellWidth)) < 0 || x >= gridWidth ||
3021                    (y = Math.round((gyo = glyph.getY() - yo)  / -font.actualCellHeight + gridHeight)) < 0 || y >= gridHeight ||
3022                    backgrounds[x][y] == 0f || (frustum != null && !frustum.boundsInFrustum(gxo, gyo, 0f, font.actualCellWidth, font.actualCellHeight, 0f)))
3023                continue;
3024            glyph.draw(batch, 1f);
3025        }
3026    }
3027}
